definition[0]: unable to understand or think clearly about what someone is saying or what is happening
example[0]: I’m totally confused. Could you explain that again?
example[1]: All the roads looked the same and he felt thoroughly confused.
example[2]: If you’re confused about anything, phone me.
definition[1]: not clear or not easy to understand
example[3]: Witness statements presented a confused picture of the incident.
definition[2]: unable to understand what someone is saying or what is happening
example[5]: I was rather confused by his question.
example[6]: She gave me a confused look.
example[7]: With the huge range of computers on the market, it’s easy to get confused.
example[8]: She felt hurt and confused when her husband left her.
definition[3]: confused because you cannot understand something, especially because it is different from what you expect
example[9]: The doctor was puzzled by the man’s symptoms and ordered several further tests.
example[10]: He had a puzzled expression on his face.
example[11]: Ross looked perplexed when the audience laughed.
definition[4]: very confused and unable to understand something, even though you have tried hard for a long time
example[12]: Detectives admit they are baffled by the case.
definition[5]: very confused and surprised when something unusual and unexpected happens to you
example[14]: He was bewildered to find three policemen at the front door.
example[15]: Bewildered train passengers watched as the man was arrested.
example[16]: At first she was bewildered by all the noise and activity of the city.
definition[6]: confused and surprised by what has happened, or by what someone has said
example[17]: Local residents seem bemused by the sudden arrival of all the tourists.
example[18]: She told him to leave, but he just sat there with a bemused expression.
definition[7]: to have difficulty thinking clearly, for example because you are too tired, too busy, or because a lot of things are happening around you
example[19]: I can’t think straight with all this noise going on.
